page.title: 14The history of a pint!
page.content:
We went round the village asking people if they knew any history of the village.
We found out that there used to be an old{Roman road}running behind one of the old farms in Pinvin. We were unable to confirm this as old maps are not easily available.
The Coach and Horses pub was given its name because it was an over night stop to change the horses and to have refreshments. The arch still stands today where the old coaches used to pass through.
The New Inn landlords have found lots of broken bones and pots, as well as old{burial grounds}and a well. This public house's name seems odd now because it clearly is not a 'new' inn.
